snippet: The change was revealed in federal court in the case of a transgender woman housed in a men’s prison who said the state illegally cut off her treatment.
abstract: Georgia says it will no longer deny new hormone therapy to transgender prison inmates and will provide them with appropriate medical and mental health treatment; policy change follows Justice Dept ruling in case of transgender inmate Ashley Diamond, finding state had illegally terminated her long-term hormone treatments after placing her in a men's prison.
lead_paragraph: The change was revealed in federal court in the case of a transgender woman housed in a men’s prison who said the state illegally cut off her treatment.

headline.main: Georgia Says It Will Allow Hormones for Transgender Inmates
headline.print_headline: Georgia Says It Will Allow Hormones for Inmates
